result.execSummary:
The defendant William H Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before  March 6, 2015.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William H Taylor in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend to misd. battery Ct. 1 & misd. DC Ct. 2.  Restitution has been paid upfront to the DA's office.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 1 & 2:  MISD BATTERY 940.19(1) & MISD. DISORDERLY CONDUCT 947.01(1)
$443.00 Costs x 2, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
5 Days (Ct. 1 only) in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Commence on or before March 6, 2015 @ 6 pm
2 days credit
Paperwork handed in court.
Jury trial on March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on February 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 2.  Bond continues.

Defendant William H Taylor appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Kevin Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Corey Chirafisi in court for Defendant William H Taylor.  Attorney Chirafisi advises court of wavier.  State did not object to appearance by phone for defendant.  Court goes through waiver of preliminary hearing with defendant over the phone.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant William H Taylor in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Chirafisi says matter may be resolved.  Needs time to provide proof of completion of AODA.  Bond continued.  Time limits contd' waived.  Prelim set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant William H Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney Chirafisi. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request signature bond.  No contact with N.T.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with N.T. or no entry into bars, taverns, liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
